dtliExcerpt: MORE than any American play of the last century, ”Our Town” stands for simple truths and eternal connections. After last year’s terrorist attacks, the search for coherence and humanity turned into an essential mission for survival. Please note: To view this review you may need to log in to a free New York Times account.
